citation: Proclamation under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970

I, the Lieutenant-Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 15C(1) of the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 â€“

        (a) give the area of land specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation, declared to be a sanctuary in the proclamation notified in the Gazette on 11 April 1951 at page number 903 and deemed to have become reserved land in the class of conservation area under Schedule 2 to the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 , the name Gull Island Conservation Area; and
        (b) give the area of land specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation, declared to be a sanctuary in the proclamation notified in the Gazette on 11 April 1951 at page number 903 and deemed to have become reserved land in the class of conservation area under Schedule 2 to the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 , the name Mile Island Conservation Area; and
        (c) give the area of land specified in Part 3 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation, declared to be a sanctuary in the proclamation notified in the Gazette on 11 April 1951 at page number 903 and deemed to have become reserved land in the class of conservation area under Schedule 2 to the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 , the name Night Island Conservation Area; and
        (d) give the area of land specified in Part 4 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation, declared to be a sanctuary in the proclamation notified in the Gazette on 11 April 1951 at page number 903 and deemed to have become reserved land in the class of conservation area under Schedule 2 to the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 , the name Oyster Rocks Conservation Area; and
        (e) give the area of land specified in Part 5 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation, declared to be a sanctuary in the proclamation notified in the Gazette on 11 April 1951 at page number 903 and deemed to have become reserved land in the class of conservation area under Schedule 2 to the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 , the name Reef Island Conservation Area; and
        (f) declare that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
26 July 2000

W. J. E. COX

Lieutenant-Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

D. E. LLEWELLYN

Minister for Primary Industries, Water and Environment

SCHEDULE 1 - Areas of land

PART 1 - Gull Island Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 13 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 4884 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 1 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 2 - Mile Island Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 7 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 4891 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 2 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 3 - Night Island Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 14 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 4892 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 3 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 4 - Oyster Rocks Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 8 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 4894 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 4 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 5 - Reef Island Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 6 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 4896 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 5 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

SCHEDULE 2 - Plans

PART 1 - Gull Island Conservation Area

PART 2 - Mile Island Conservation Area

PART 3 - Night Island Conservation Area

PART 4 - Oyster Rocks Conservation Area

PART 5 - Reef Island Conservation Area

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 2 August 2000

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Primary Industries, Water and Environment.
